item.title: Largest Public Electric Vehicle Charging Center in California Opens - Solar Thermal Magazine
item.description:
Largest Public Electric Vehicle Charging Center in California Opens - Solar Thermal Magazine

The largest public multi-standard electric vehicle charging facility in California officially opened today in Santa Clara, as city and electric vehicle (EV) industry officials celebrated the Santa Clara Electric Vehicle Charging Center located at the city's Tasman Parking Garage.

item.title: Global Wind Power On the Increase
item.description:
Global Wind Power On the Increase

Following a slowdown in new wind installations during 2013, the market rebounded during 2014 with a 44% increase to exceed 50GW for the first time. According to the Global Wind Energy Council (GWEC), which compiles the global wind statistics, this figure is a solid sign of the recovery of the industry after a rough patch in the past few years.

item.title: COP 21 Climate Agreement Sets Scene For Energy Sector
item.description:
COP 21 Climate Agreement Sets Scene For Energy Sector

After months of discussion and two weeks with a mass of reports and headline dominating news, the outcomes of the Paris climate talks, aka COP 21, emerged, exceeding most people's expectations.

item.title: Energy Efficiency-An Energy Source Not To Be Underestimated
item.description:
Energy Efficiency-An Energy Source Not To Be Underestimated

Energy efficiency will play a critical role in limiting world energy demand growth to one-third by 2040, while the global economy grows by 150%.

item.title: Google's 'Project Sunroof' To Map Solar Potential
item.description:
Google's 'Project Sunroof' To Map Solar Potential

Google Earth has revolutionized our mapping of the Earth both from an overhead and on the ground perspective - and now it seems set to do the same for the increasing number of people, encouraged by the reducing technology costs, who want to go green and reduce their energy costs by installing solar PV.

item.title: Microgrids - Key For Electrification
item.description:
Microgrids - Key For Electrification

With more than 1 billion people around the world without access to electricity and the goal to achieve universal access by 2030, new cost effective and functional solutions that can be easily deployed in often remote, hard to reach or harsh environments are needed.

item.title: Mini-grids To Power Africa's Rural Electrification
item.description:
Mini-grids To Power Africa's Rural Electrification

Bringing access to modern energy services to the more than 620 million people (in 2012) and increasing in sub-Saharan Africa - almost half of the global total - currently living without access is one of the major challenges facing African countries in their quest for development.

item.title: Rooftop PV Set For Rapid Growth In Africa
item.description:
Rooftop PV Set For Rapid Growth In Africa

Solar photovoltaic (PV) deployment is a relatively new market in Africa and has been dominated by ground installations. But over the next 5 years rooftop installations are expected to grow rapidly to over 35% of market installations, especially in South Africa.

item.title: Global Climate Change: NASA scientists react to 400 ppm carbon milestone
item.description:
Global Climate Change: NASA scientists react to 400 ppm carbon milestone

The global concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere - the primary driver of recent climate change - has reached 400 parts per million (ppm) for the first time in recorded history, according to data from the Mauna Loa Observatory in Hawaii.

item.title: Graphic: Global warming from 1880 to 2015
item.description:
Graphic: Global warming from 1880 to 2015

Earth's 2015 surface temperatures were the warmest since modern record keeping began in 1880, according to independent analyses by NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). Globally-averaged temperatures in 2015 shattered the previous mark set in 2014 by 0.23 degrees Fahrenheit (0.13 Celsius).
